channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: Crypto sees 5th week of outflows on 'poor' BTC sentiment: Coinshares
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.description: Outflows across all digital asset investment products hit $232 million over the past five weeks, with BTC-related funds leading the carnage, per Coinshares.

item.title: US risks losing the crypto race to UAE, Korea, Aus and Switzerland: Ark
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Mitchelhill
item.description: The U.S. crypto ecosystem is facing a “void” of well-established and credible institutions, according to an analyst from Ark Invest.

item.title: AI-generated image of Pentagon explosion causes stock market stutter
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: The fake image was shared by a verified Twitter account masquerading as Bloomberg and went viral after being amplified by real media outlets.

item.title: Should Bored Apes or other NFTs be regulated as securities?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Todd White & Ralph Benko
item.description: Bored Apes look a lot like baseball cards. But regulators — particularly at the Securities and Exchange Commission — are making a strained case to the contrary.

item.title: Bitcoin volatility drops amid decline in liquidity, but a possible catalyst is approaching
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Kyle White
item.description: Bitcoin volatility has dropped as new liquidity is not flowing into the market, but on-chain data presents multiple reasons why BTC investors continue to hold.

item.title: Dash blockchain down for hours after hard fork fail, devs to try upgrade again June 14
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: The v19 hard fork didn’t go as planned for the privacy coin, but a fix has been released; v18 had experienced a few kinks, too.

item.title: G7 discusses crypto, supports CBDC — Law Decoded, May 15–22
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By David Attlee
item.description: The European Council has approved updated rules that extend tax reporting requirements to include transfers of crypto assets.

item.title: OpenAI warns superhuman AI may arrive within a decade: ‘We have to get it right’
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tristan Greene
item.description: OpenAI leadership weighed the pros and cons of trying to stop the development of superhuman AI and decided it was in humanity’s best interest to forge ahead.

item.title: Bitcoin price consolidation at $27,000 sparks speculation of imminent BTC breakout
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marcel Pechman
item.description: BTC’s price could be on the verge of a bullish breakout, according to derivatives data, but ultimately the macroeconomic scenario will dictate the trend.

item.title: Rising BTC transaction fees are a good thing, Bitcoin educator shares
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Judith BannermanQuist
item.description: Dan Held, the chief marketing officer at Trust Machines, believes that rising Bitcoin transaction fees may encourage users to look at other layer-2 solutions.

item.title: South Korea to vote on bill requiring crypto asset disclosure for lawmakers
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tristan Greene
item.description: A recent political scandal has prompted the proposal of legislation intended to ensure South Korean officials report all digital asset holdings above roughly $760.

item.title: 2 more rate hikes? Bitcoin analyst counts down to ‘huge’ volatility
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: Bitcoin fails to respond even to a market-moving fake news event about an explosion at the Pentagon.

item.title: Philippines SEC says Gemini Derivatives is unregistered securities product
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: Gemini Derivatives is available on the exchange’s new Foundation platform, but those selling or promoting it in the Philippines face fines and long imprisonment.

item.title: Price analysis 5/22: SPX, DXY, BTC, ETH, BNB, XRP, ADA, DOGE, SOL, MATIC
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Rakesh Upadhyay
item.description: Bitcoin’s tight-range trading suggests that traders are content to wait for a catalyst to start the next trending move.

item.title: Korean crypto executives allegedly profited $2.3M from coin listing scandal
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: Projects were allegedly swayed into signing contracts with dubious market makers as consideration for listing on crypto exchange Coinone.

item.title: TON Foundation launches $25M accelerator program
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: The accelerator will invest between $50,000 and $250,000 per project that builds on TON and has an MVP.

item.title: When pizza became the unsung hero of Bitcoin’s history: A cheesy celebration
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Guneet Kaur
item.description: Join the cheesy celebration and learn how Bitcoin Pizza Day shaped the adoption of cryptocurrencies.

item.title: US university gets $20M to create new AI institute
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: The U.S.-based university Carnegie Mellon received $20 million in federal funding to create a brand new AI institute aimed at shaping public policy.

item.title: Why is Bitcoin price stuck?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Yashu Gola
item.category: why is bitcoin price not moving
item.description: Bitcoin is a volatile asset, but BTC price can get stuck inside narrow trading ranges for weeks, if not months, for multiple reasons.

item.title: AI financial tools: A smart way to manage money or a risky experiment?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Francisco Rodrigues
item.description: AI is transforming the world of finance, but is it ready for the retail sector? Experts weigh in.

item.title: Illuvium controversy, Aurory Prologue review, Fornite CEO salty, Assassin’s Creed NFTs: Web3 Gamer
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Callan Quinn
item.description: Illuvium’s many marketing controversies, Assasin’s Creed’s NFT cubes, Fortnite CEO salty about death of metaverse, Aurory Prologue review.

item.title: 13 years after first Bitcoin purchase, layer-2 solutions struggle to gain traction
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: In an interview with Cointelegraph, Trust Machines CEO Muneeb Ali explains how Ordinals’ hype could support Bitcoin by attracting more developers and capital to layer-2 solutions.

item.title: AI in the metaverse: How proof-of-identity provides human experiences
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Victoria Kennedy
item.description: As AI develops apace, concern about proof-of-humanity is growing.

item.title: GameFi developer Gala Games to launch Web3 poker platform with PokerGO
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: “Players will soon realize the heightened entertainment that comes with playing poker in an immersive Web3 environment,” said Eric Schiermeyer, founder of Gala Games.

item.title: Responsible AI can create policies to help ‘better serve society’
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: Sabin Dima, the CEO and founder of Humans.Ai, said that with the right implementation, governments could use AI to enhance public services and policies.

item.title: Bitcoin Pizza Day 2023: Community celebrates anniversary of first known BTC transaction
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: Redditors wondered where the 10,000 BTC went, with some speculating it was sold when the price surged, while others suggested the keys may have been lost.

item.title: The pepperoni on the first pizza bought with Bitcoin is worth $6.5M today
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: The first known crypto transaction was 10,000 BTC for two pizzas. Thirteen years on, its ingredients alone equate to millions of dollars worth of Bitcoin.

item.title: The US Treasury is running out of cash — Trouble ahead for Bitcoin?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marcel Pechman
item.description: Cointelegraph analyst and writer Marcel Pechman explains how and why the U.S. Treasury is quickly running out of cash, and what that means for Bitcoin and the crypto market.

item.title: Huobi Global ordered to halt operations in Malaysia
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Gareth Jenkinson
item.description: Securities Commission Malaysia has ordered Huobi Global to stop all activity after failing to register to operate in the country.

item.title: Longing for liquidity — 5 things to know in Bitcoin this week
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: Hopes mount for a breakout from the narrow BTC price trading range; what are the odds it will happen?
